intro: Ipomopsis congesta subsp. montana, commonly known as the mountain ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at higher elevations. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
